Thank you, Jim.  Yes, I could see the feature on those.
  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Jim Gilbert 
  To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Wednesday, July 16, 2003 12:05 PM
  Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Owari Tsuba


  David,
  I took a couple of quick photos of the rim of the 3rd generation piece I mentioned earlier today.  

  http://tinyurl.com/h502

  It is very strongly top lit to bring out the senkotsu.  Look near the upper surface of the guard just below the hot spot from the light.  The second photo is a slight rotation from the first one so that you can follow the feature.  It continues for a few cm.  Somewhat less prominent ones occur at other locations on the rim.  I'm not sure if this will help.  Trying to exaggerate the appearance of a subtle feature can create more confusion.

  Jim



    I have placed two photos of presumed senkotsu in an Owari tsuba here:

    http://www.zincavage.org/Tsuba-index.htm
